channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bathroad carpark taken over by electric vehicle charging stations?, 10th February
item.description:
"the average cost to buy an electric car in the UK is around £46,000," "Average Income in Gloucestershire The average annual salary in Gloucestershire is £35,631 , and the median salary is £34,400." How can the council justify this giant proportion of carpark spaces for the 1 or 2 % of the population of Gloucester County who can purchase these vehicles? When the potholes on nearly every road are to the point of vehicle-damaging?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Sandford Mill Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole in road near kerb-last reported about 6 months ago and not properly repaired. The waste or time and money temporary repair has given way to even deeper pothole which could cause cyclist or motor cyclist to lose control. Also smaller but just as deep pothole on opposite carriageway, 10th February
item.description:
Traffic reservation just north of Hunters Road Finlay Way junction. Potholes both sides of carriageway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bramble Chase, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mud dumped by Highways, 10th February
item.description:
Regarding ongoing enquiry 22069827. I have been away for the weekend and found that mud places on the verge by Highways department is being spread all across the pavement. I have seen pedestrians struggling to negotiate the mud. What is happening with this mud? Surely it can’t be left in this manner? Any amount of rain will render this mud a hazard to foot traffic along the pavement, and this is a situation created by Highways. Again, this resolution is unsatisfactory and has clearly made the initial situation worse not better. The situation needs resolving properly and permanently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Beeches Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
